Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Nurses across California may soon have easier access to more career opportunities, if Gov. Gavin Newsom signs a new bill into law.
According to the Board of Registered Nursing, 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: program officials reported that the inability to secure clinical placements is one of the main reasons for not enrolling more students

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: aspiring nurses, especially students in public programs, are being denied access to clinical placements

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the Board of Registered Nursing, 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements.
Document Sources.Source Justification: reporting on publicly funded nursing programs

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: As California’s population ages and becomes increasingly more diverse, we will need a qualified and experienced nursing workforce to meet the unique demands and varied needs of all patients.
Clinical education is an essential part of any nurse’s education, yet aspiring nurses, especially students in public programs, are being denied access to clinical placements.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Registered Nurse and President of the CNA
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: representing the California Nurses Association, sponsor of SB 1015

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: We applaud the California Senate for passing S.B. 1015. It is commonsense reform that will increase transparency and increase oversight from the Board of Registered Nursing.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Registered Nurse and President of the CNA
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: representing the California Nurses Association, sponsor of SB 1015

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The California Nurses Association (CNA), the largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsored SB 1015 to support nursing students seeking placement in the workforce.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsor of SB 1015

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: If approved, SB 1015 would mandate new levels of transparency for clinical placements and help develop placement standards that ensure equitable access to opportunities in the workforce.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: passing S.B. 1015, subject of the bill
